intro: Boechera duriuscula, commonly known as the desert rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. This species is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and its ability to thrive in arid and rocky environments. Its small, white or yellow flowers appear in early spring, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Boechera duriuscula is adapted to withstand drought and poor soil conditions, making it a resilient plant in desert ecosystems.
